data.title: Bad calculations
data.solution:
import re

text = input()
a, b, c = [int(m.group(0)) for m in re.finditer(r'[0-9]+', text)]
if a + b == c:
    print('Sounds about right.')
else:
    print(f'It makes {a + b}, not {c}!')

testCases.title: Expression
testCases.testIn: ... oh yeah, as sure as 1 and 1 make 3! Also, there was...

testCases.title: Expression
testCases.testIn: ... for certain, just as much as 2 and 3 make 4. There's also...

testCases.title: Finances
testCases.testIn: ... so he took these 98 and that 102 euros, and he told me it made 400 euros. Sounded about right to me, so I cleared the transaction...

testCases.title: Finances
testCases.testIn: ... she payed something like 12 pounds for the burger, and 45 for her friends' meal, so about 80 pounds for the whole lot...

testCases.title: Life
testCases.testIn: I bought those 2 two new games for my nephew the other day, but he already has something around 19. Can you imagine having 25 games at home?

testCases.title: Life
testCases.testIn: ... you add these 90 tomatoes to your 80 cucumbers, and you have about 150 vegetables, I think?

testCases.title: Salary
testCases.testIn: I've received 2000 pounds on top of my 2500 pounds a month salary, so that's about 4500 pounds...

testCases.title: Salary
testCases.testIn: You'll get about 64800 a year, with bonuses going up to 20000 on the same period, so about 84800 bucks in total!

testCases.title: Scores
testCases.testIn: The match lasted forever, we ended up at 67-68, so 145 whole points in total! Isn't that nuts?

testCases.title: Scores
testCases.testIn: I won 7-6, but it was a really tough match since we had to play 11 rounds!

testCases.title: Party
testCases.testIn: ... yeah, on Christmas, my sister had around 60 guests at hers while I had only 40, so I've had less, but look at it like this: combined, we've had a mighty 100!

testCases.title: Party
testCases.testIn: I bought around 18 bags of crisps, and other salty stuff, and my guests ended up bringing around 12, so we had the equivalent of 30 bags in bowls; you bet we got stuffed!

data.inputDescription: <<First line:>> A [[text]] containing the overheard bit of conversation.
data.outputDescription: <<First line:>> The real and overhead sum, with the format {{It makes [[real sum]], not [[overheard sum]]!}}, or {{Sounds about right.}} if both are equal.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You're overhearing a conversation between two people who are very bad at maths, and can't help but want to fix their bad calculations in your head.

You are provided with the bit of conversation containing three positive numbers in numeric form. The third number is the sum of the first two according to the speaker. These numbers may be separated by any (non-null) amount of non-numeric characters (words, punctuation, spaces, and so on).

If the overheard sum is incorrect, you must output both the correct sum of the first two numbers and the sum according to the speaker, with the following format:

It makes correct sum, not overheard sum!

Otherwise, you must output the following:

Sounds about right.
Input
First line: A text containing the overheard bit of conversation.
Output
First line: The real and overhead sum, with the format It makes real sum, not overheard sum!, or Sounds about right. if both are equal.
Constraints
0 < length(text) < 256
0 < overheard sum < 1000
0 < correct sum < 1000
Example
Input
... oh yeah, as sure as 1 and 1 make 3! Also, there was...
Output
It makes 2, not 3!
